div.p: B84/8431, unit 57, VPRS 3992/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

note.p: MS written by G. Luehmann and signed by M.

div.p: To the Honorable the Chief Secretary
I have the honor to submit for approval the following Estimate* of Expenditure during the Quarter ending 31st December 1884.

cell.p:
Total — Eight hundred and sixty two pounds ten shillings and
pen

p.seg: There is an illegible initial in the Remarks column against the total.

cell.style: border: none; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;

note.p: There is no signature here; however, T. Wilson, Under Secretary, has initialled the Estimate on the lower right of the document.M subsequently submitted a revised set of Estimates, for the period to 30 November 1884 only, and these were approved by Berry; see M to G. Berry, 22 September 1884.

cell.style: border: none; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
cell.p: Signature of the Officer authorized to certify to accounts Ferd. von Mueller.
